Wikipedia contains 5,779,818 pages.
There are a total of 454,992,698 links between Wikipedia pages.
8,546,501 Wikipedia pages are actually just redirects to other pages.
"List of current U.S. state legislators" is the Wikipedia page with the highest number of outgoing links (8,366).
"List of people from Illinois" is the Wikipedia page with the second highest number of outgoing links (8,078).
"List of least concern birds" is the Wikipedia page with the third highest number of outgoing links (7,898).
"List of stage names" is the Wikipedia page with the fourth highest number of outgoing links (6,664).
"List of film director and actor collaborations" is the Wikipedia page with the fifth highest number of outgoing links (6,520).
"Geographic coordinate system" is the most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,080,991 incoming links).
"International Standard Book Number" is the second most linked to page on Wikipedia (1,042,046 incoming links).
"Virtual International Authority File" is the third most linked to page on Wikipedia (525,102 incoming links).
"WorldCat" is the fourth most linked to page on Wikipedia (488,891 incoming links).
"United States" is the fifth most linked to page on Wikipedia (472,057 incoming links).
The first Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "!!".
The last Wikipedia page title in alphabetical order is "ùïä".
392 Wikipedia pages (0.007% of all pages) have no incoming or outgoing links.
There are only 1,441 Wikipedia pages (0.02% of all pages) which link to no other pages.
There are 313,472 Wikipedia pages (5.42% of all pages) which are not linked to from any other page.

The "List of lists of lists" page is a list of pages that are lists of list pages on the English Wikipedia.

The "Names of large numbers" page contains words like "googol" (10^100) and "millinillion" (10^3003).
An "Illegal prime" is a prime number that represents information whose possession or distribution is forbidden in some legal jurisdictions.
